critique: The document is a legal order, so the primary emotions the President wants to elicit are related to trust and confidence in the legal system. There is no explicit mention of emotions, so I will have to infer them from the context and tone. The tone is formal and authoritative, which suggests a desire to inspire confidence and respect for the law. The actions described are amendments to the Manual for Courts-Martial, which implies a desire to improve the military justice system. The President likely wants to elicit a sense of joy that justice is being served, sadness that injustice may have occurred in the past, and perhaps a bit of surprise that changes are being made. There is no indication of anger, fear, or disgust. The intensity of these emotions is likely to be low, as the document is primarily a legal matter.
